RT @CornellWBrooks 100 years ago, the @NAACP was born to oppose lynching deaths—specifically the Springfield Race Riot of 1908– where 1000s became refugees of racial terrorism & others killed. Over 11 decades, many have tried & failed to get federal protection.Its past time for @SenBooker ‘s bill. https://twitter.com/senbooker/status/1050520228029968385 QT @SenBooker Today the anti-lynching bill I introduced w/ Senators Harris & Scott passed out of committee. Our bill is a painful, but necessary, acknowledgement of our nation’s horrific past of racialized violence. We’re now one step closer to finally making lynching a federal crime.

We are facing a two-pronged attack on our democracy — unlimited money poured into the political process, paired with the systematic suppression of the vote. Our time to fight and defend our voting rights and democracy is now.

The census is supposed to get a full and accurate count of the U.S. population. By weaponizing the census, this Administration is violating the idea that everyone counts.
